author: eztero
title: CardanoPlusPlus, a C++ Library
description: There is no common libraries to help C++ Developers build on Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: Since C++ is an important programming language and appears to have many advantages in creating and developing apps, it is still commonly used among developers. Having a library with pre-written code can help creators reduce the times needed for making apps and bring them opportunities to complete other factors. This library not only brings convenience for programmers but also gives them efficient, secure and regularly updated codes, which i believe, can attract more contributors to join in and increase adoption of the Cardano ecosystem. The author also showed the benefit of the library by giving out 6 functions of it. When it comes to identifying the main challenges in the future, the author can clearly foresee the difficulties and also come up with some solutions which I think can help raise the reliability of this project.
f6_assessments.q1: I can generally see that the author has given a very clear and logical timeline with the amount of hours needed for 6 different divided phases. By doing this, voters and the community can easily follow the process of the project. The budget breakdown is also very brief and concise to understand.
f6_assessments.q2: Giving a platform such as github where voters and the community can audit the process is a great idea. However, I think you should detaily describe what the result will be basing on the key metrics, which can help the community visualize the success easily and know the development of this project through its stages.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal identifies a gap area that there are not many libraries to help C++ OR C developers to build on Cardano. As a C++ developer myself for over 7+ years in the past, I totally agree that this library will have its use cases and will help a very wide range of C/C++ developers out there who would want to build on Cardano.

C++ is well known in the tech industry for its strengths w.r.t speed and efficient usage of resources e.g. memory management. Additionally, it can be seen in the comments that one of the funded proposals teams already was looking for some C based libraries and wanted such a library for their use case.

The proposer provides the solution and explains very well what functionalities are intended to be provided with this library. The proposer will keep the library as close as possible to C implementation so that not only C++ developers can use it but also projects that need C compatibility could use this library. Additionally, the proposer proposes that the library will have all the dependencies included and will not use any external libraries, increasing the portability and fulfilling a wider developer audience in future. In my opinion, this is a very nice consideration for any open source project.

Therefore, I strongly agree that this library fulfills and fits nicely with the requirements of the impact section of this challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is the single person working on this project and has provided youtube and github links to the work he has already done. I have gone through the library code already (although the code is still work in progress) and he has provided BIP39 (mnemonic verification feature based on bitcoin improvement proposals that are also taken as base by CIP cardano improvement proposals) code. This is a good sign, as it showcases that the proposer has been thinking and working on this project already even before the proposal was made on catalyst. 

However, a public linkedin profile would have been a nice addition, as it is not yet clear with the link what sort of work experience this person holds and since he is the sole developer, it would be nice to see him and his previous work experience. Budget (around $25k) is well justified and a detailed timeline has been given in terms of man hours, with each of the CIP standards that the proposer is planning to implement in this library. 

As a developer myself who has worked for a significant number of years on C++, the timelines are well thought and realistic. 

However, I have few concerns with respect to the risks associated with this project. The proposer has mentioned that he is in process of understanding the technical details of how Cardano works, and hence I believe this will be very important to fulfill the project implementation within the provided man hour estimates. I, therefore, see some potential issues that might come up as blockers or potential delays to the implementation of this proposal.

However, overall, a well written proposal and therefore I agree that it is quite feasible this project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
I agree that this proposal has provided sufficient information for the community to track the progress and successful implementation of this project. The detailed timeline provided are in sync with the number of features that the proposer wants to implement as part of this library.

Each of these features are split based on the CIP counterpart of the BIP based implementations. In essence this shows that the proposer knows in detail what features are needed to fulfill this library implementation. 

The success metric of this proposal can be tracked by the community by seeing the number of users/downloads on this library, however, I would have loved to see some ideas from proposer on how he would let the community know that such a library is in place and developers can make use of it if they intend to e.g. add to the cardano essentials documentation ? 

Nevertheless, a well written proposal, and I wish good luck to the proposer and look forward to onboard many C++/C developers to the Cardano ecosystem.
